item.question: The average score of three tests with scores of a, b, and c.
item.explanation:
Average is computed by adding all the values and dividing by the number of values.

For example, if the scores were 70, 80, and 90, then the average score would be 70 + 80 + 90 3 = 240 3 = 80 . So, the answer is a + b + c 3 .

item.question: The age in years of someone who is twice as old as Cayenne, if Cayenne is C years old.
item.explanation:
If Cayenne is 5 years old, then twice that is
<math> <mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> <mo>*</mo> <mtext>5</mtext> <mo>=</mo> <mtext selected="true">10</mtext> </mrow> </math>
, if Cayenne is 7 years old, then twice that is would be
<math> <mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> <mo>*</mo> <mtext>7</mtext> <mo>=</mo> <mtext selected="true">14</mtext> </mrow> </math>
years old. If Cayenne is C years old, then twice that would be
<math> <mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> <mo>*</mo> <mtext>C</mtext> </mrow> </math>
years old.

item.question: The number of minutes it takes me to read 7 pages if I read 1 page in M minutes.
item.explanation:
It takes M minutes to read 1 page, <math> <mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> <mo>*</mo> <mtext>M</mtext> </mrow> </math>
minutes to read 2 pages,
<math> <mrow> <mtext>3</mtext> <mo>*</mo> <mtext>M</mtext> </mrow> </math>
minutes to read 3 pages, etc. So it takes
<math> <mrow> <mtext>7</mtext> <mo>*</mo> <mtext>M</mtext> </mrow> </math>
minutes to read 7 pages.

item.question: The perimeter, in units, of an equilateral triangle with each side L units long.
item.explanation:
An equilateral triangle has three equal sides. The perimeter of a triangle is the sum of the lengths of the three sides. For our triangle, the perimeter is
<math> <mrow> <mtext>L</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>L</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>L</mtext> </mrow> </math>
which simplifies to
<math> <mrow> <mtext>3</mtext> <mo>*</mo> <mtext>L</mtext> </mrow> </math>
or
<math> <mrow> <mtext>3L</mtext> </mrow> </math>
.

item.question: The number of months it takes to grow one foot of hair, if the hair grows N inches per month.
item.explanation:
There are 12 inches in 1 foot. Therefore, we divide 12 by the number of inches per month to get the answer. For example, if hair grows 2 inches per month, then in
<math> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mfrac> <mtext>12</mtext> <mtext>2</mtext> </mfrac> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>= 6</mtext> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </math>
months to grow one foot. So, at N inches per month it would take
<math> <mrow> <mfrac bevelled="true"> <mtext>12</mtext> <mtext selected="true">N</mtext> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>
months.

item.question: Number of gallons of gas it takes to go 50 miles if you get G miles per gallon.
item.explanation:
At 10 miles per gallon, it will take
<math> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mfrac> <mtext>50</mtext> <mtext>10</mtext> </mfrac> </mtd> <mtd> <mo>=</mo> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext selected="true">5</mtext> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </math>
gallons. At 25 miles per gallon, it will take
<math> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mfrac> <mtext>50</mtext> <mtext>25</mtext> </mfrac> </mtd> <mtd> <mo>=</mo> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext selected="true">2</mtext> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </math>
gallons. So, at G miles per gallon it will take me
<math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mtext>50</mtext> <mtext selected="true">G</mtext> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>
gallons.

item.question: The number of minutes required to watch half of an M-minute movie.
item.explanation:
To find half of any quantity, divide by 2. For example, half of a 110 minute movie would take
<math> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mfrac> <mtext>110</mtext> <mtext>2</mtext> </mfrac> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>=</mtext> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext selected="true">55</mtext> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </math>
minutes. So, half of an M-minute movie would take
<math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mtext>M</mtext> <mtext selected="true">2</mtext> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>
minutes.

item.question: The sum of two consecutive numbers with N as the first one.
item.explanation:
As an example, 5 and 6 are two consecutive numbers. Their sum would be
<math> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mtext>5</mtext> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>+</mtext> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>6</mtext> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>=</mtext> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext selected="true">11</mtext> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </math>
. If the first number is
<math> <mrow> <mtext>N</mtext> </mrow> </math>
, then the next one would be
<math> <mrow> <mtext>N</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>1</mtext> </mrow> </math>
. The sum would be
<math> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mtext>N</mtext> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>+</mtext> <mfenced> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mtext selected="true">N</mtext> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>+</mtext> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>1</mtext> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mfenced> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </math>
which simplifies to
<math> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mtext>2N</mtext> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext>+</mtext> </mtd> <mtd> <mtext selected="true">1</mtext> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </math>
.

item.question: The total score of a football game with T 6-pointer touchdowns, F 3-pointer field goals, and C 1-point conversions.
item.explanation:
As an example, three touchdowns give
<math> <mrow> <mtext>3</mtext> <mo>*</mo> <mtext>6</mtext> <mo>=</mo> <mtext>18</mtext> </mrow> </math>
points, 5 field goals add
<math> <mrow> <mtext>5</mtext> <mo>*</mo> <mtext>3</mtext> <mo>=</mo> <mtext>15</mtext> </mrow> </math>
more points, and 3 conversions add
<math> <mrow> <mtext>3</mtext> <mo>*</mo> <mtext>1</mtext> <mo>=</mo> <mtext>3</mtext> </mrow> </math>
points. So the answer using
<math> <mrow> <mtext>T</mtext> </mrow> </math>
,
<math> <mrow> <mtext>F</mtext> </mrow> </math>
and
<math> <mrow> <mtext>C</mtext> </mrow> </math>
would be
<math> <mrow> <mtext>6T</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>3F</mtext> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>C</mtext> </mrow> </math>
.
